intro: Gutembergia cupricola, commonly known as the copperleaf, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its striking copper-colored leaves. The plant produces showy, pink to purple flowers that bloom in summer. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it a popular ornamental plant. Its unique foliage and vibrant blooms make it a valuable addition to gardens and botanical collections.
